task.title: Setting up on Windows
task.shortdesc: The add-on requires to be installed on your machine. Unless is already installed, you must install it and complete a basic configuration.

prereq.p: If you do not already have an account on a shared version control hosting platform, create an account. Alternatively, if you are part of an organization, request access from your project administrator or DevOps team.

step.stepresult: The download of the installer file starts automatically. Depending on your browser's settings, you may need to confirm the download.

step.cmd: From the Downloads folder, launch the installation wizard and complete the process by following the on-screen instructions.
When the installation is completed, on the Completing the Git Setup Wizard page, select the Launch Git Bash check box, and click Next.
In the Git Bash terminal window, configure your user name and email address by substituting the variables with your credentials:

info.pre: git config --global --user.name="First Name Last Name" git config --global --user.email="email@example.com"

step.cmd: Verify that your name and email are set correctly by listing the user configuration settings:
step.stepxmp: Example output:$ git config --list | grep "user" user.name=John Doe user.email=john.doe@email.com

result.p: is now correctly installed and configured.
